path_1.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
path_1.feeling: Broad sequel antics wear thin despite the outback charm.

path_1.title: Mulan (1998)
path_1.feeling: Stirring heroine’s journey with memorable moments, even if some songs are just okay.

path_1.title: Nightmare Before Christmas, The (1993)
path_1.feeling: Inventive and macabrely charming, more clever than emotionally gripping for me.

path_1.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
path_1.feeling: Whimsical premise with heartfelt father-son resonance that lands.

path_1.title: Emma (1996)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant period matchmaking, witty but a bit airy for my taste.

path_1.title: Godfather, The (1972)
path_1.feeling: Immersive, weighty crime saga with impeccable craft and moral gravity.

path_1.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_1.feeling: Darkly funny and unsettling look at suburban rot that lingers.

path_1.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_1.feeling: Lovely idea, but the musical pacing drags and blunts the magic.

path_1.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_1.feeling: Taut, cynical noir with crackling dialogue and atmosphere.

path_1.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_1.feeling: Concept intrigues, but the execution feels repetitive and shrill.

path_1.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_1.feeling: Warm, nostalgic vignettes with songs that can feel a bit saccharine.

path_1.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_1.feeling: Bleak, twisty time-travel puzzle that engages more than it moves me.

path_1.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_1.feeling: The meta joke wears out quickly, leaving thin, TV-sketch energy.

path_1.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_1.feeling: Glossy fairy tale romance that goes down easy but feels flimsy.

path_1.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_1.feeling: Solid animated adventure with a clear arc, if not deeply affecting for me.

path_1.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_1.feeling: Slick cat-and-mouse romance with stylish heist fun.

path_1.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
path_1.feeling: Acidic, razor-sharp satire whose chill outweighs belly laughs for me.

path_1.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_1.feeling: Cute caper with a memorable villain, though fairly light.

path_1.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)
path_1.feeling: Swashbuckling fun with charm, if somewhat conventional.

path_1.title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
path_1.feeling: Propulsive set pieces and snappy banter make for a solid ride.

path_1.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_1.feeling: Classic ensemble western with sturdy character beats.

path_1.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_1.feeling: Gentle adventure with heart, modest but likable.

path_1.title: Matilda (1996)
path_1.feeling: Smart, spirited children’s tale with genuine warmth and bite.

path_1.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious, darker-toned animation whose themes resonate.

path_1.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_1.feeling: Zippy, jokey romp that amuses more than it sticks.

path_1.title: Funny Face (1957)
path_1.feeling: Breezy confection with pretty trappings but thin substance.

path_1.title: Superman (1978)
path_1.feeling: Earnest, classic heroism with charm, if a bit dated in action.

path_1.title: Blast from the Past (1999)
path_1.feeling: Sweet premise and performances, but the comedy is uneven.

path_2.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)

path_2.feeling: Earnest courage and duty gave this rousing arc real lift for me.

path_3.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_3.feeling: Glossy suburban malaise with sharp observations, a touch self-important.

path_3.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_3.feeling: Misty romance and song leave me unmoved despite the conceit.

path_3.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_3.feeling: Flinty noir puzzle whose hard edges still gleam.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: High-concept menace that feels schematic and shrill to me.

path_3.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_3.feeling: Warm, polished Americana with lovely moments, light on urgency.

path_3.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_3.feeling: Bleak, knotty time-loop paranoia that grips more than it comforts.

path_3.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_3.feeling: One-joke culture clash that amuses in spurts then wears thin.

path_3.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_3.feeling: Glossy fairytale chemistry that goes down easy but leaves little echo.

path_3.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_3.feeling: Straightforward leadership fable that earns some warmth despite familiar beats.

path_3.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse caper—charming, glib, and fun if not deep.

path_3.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
path_3.feeling: Brisk, razor satire that makes annihilation feel absurdly, chillingly inevitable.

path_3.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_3.feeling: Spry rescue caper with charm to spare, if ultimately slight.

path_3.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)
path_3.feeling: Rousing swashbuckler where charisma and craft trump depth.

path_3.title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
path_3.feeling: Clever, propulsive set pieces and sparky rapport, light on moral weight.

path_3.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_3.feeling: Lean, humane ensemble western that builds tension with economy.

path_3.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_3.feeling: Modest, sweet rescue adventure that gently carries you along.

path_3.title: Matilda (1996)
path_3.feeling: Sly, satisfying kid-against-cruelty fable that earns its triumphs.

path_3.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
path_3.feeling: Surprisingly dark moral core under a polished Disney surface—affecting.

path_3.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_3.feeling: Breezy, gag-driven romp—amusing, insubstantial.

path_3.title: Funny Face (1957)
path_3.feeling: Pretty confections and tunes wrapped around thin stakes.

path_3.title: Superman (1978)
path_3.feeling: Sincere mythmaking whose charm outweighs the corn, if only just.

path_3.title: Blast from the Past (1999)
path_3.feeling: Cute fish-out-of-time conceit—amiable, featherlight.

path_3.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
path_3.feeling: Broad fish-out-of-water hijinks with gangsters—too thin for me.

path_3.title: Mulan (1998)
path_3.feeling: Stirring duty-and-identity arc that earns its uplift even if it stays a touch tidy.

path_3.title: Nightmare Before Christmas, The (1993)
path_3.feeling: Macabre whimsy and craft I admire more than I’m moved by.

path_3.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
path_3.feeling: Sincere, magical sentiment that touches even as the corn gets thick.

path_3.title: Emma (1996)
path_3.feeling: Witty meddling and manners amuse, though the romance feels tidy and low-stakes.

path_3.title: Godfather, The (1972)
path_3.feeling: Elegant, bruising crime saga where power and family curdle into tragedy.

path_3.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_3.feeling: Acerbic suburban rot and yearning—sharp even if its pose shows.

path_3.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_3.feeling: Sumptuous conceit stranded by gauzy sentiment—I stay at a distance.

path_3.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_3.feeling: Flinty, coiled noir where motive and greed tighten every exchange.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: Conceptual dread undermined by thin human threads—never lands for me.

path_3.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_3.feeling: Warm period glow and tunes, pleasant if emotionally light for me.

path_3.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_3.feeling: Bleak, twisty time-loop paranoia with human stakes that linger.

path_3.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_3.feeling: Broad meta-gag that wears thin fast—too wink-wink to bite.

path_3.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_3.feeling: Glossy fairy tale chemistry that goes down easy but feels hollow.

path_3.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_3.feeling: Classic coming-of-age nobility framed for families—sturdy, if safe.

path_3.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse caper where charm outpaces substance, still fun.

path_3.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
path_3.feeling: Brisk, razor satire that makes annihilation chillingly, absurdly inevitable.

path_3.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_3.feeling: Light, lively rescue romp—charming more than gripping.

path_3.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)
path_3.feeling: Swashbuckling mentorship and revenge—polished, enjoyable if airy.

path_3.title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
path_3.feeling: Propulsive urban cat-and-mouse that satisfies even without much depth.

path_3.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_3.feeling: Lean ensemble western where character and peril mesh cleanly.

path_3.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_3.feeling: Gently adventurous and kind, pleasant rather than transporting.

path_3.title: Matilda (1996)
path_3.feeling: Cheeky, cathartic takedown of cruelty that earns its triumph.

path_3.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
path_3.feeling: Darker moral undercurrents give the spectacle weight, though the sentiment sometimes blunts it.

path_3.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_3.feeling: Zippy, silly ego-check farce—smart enough to keep me smiling.

path_3.title: Funny Face (1957)
path_3.feeling: Glossy, featherweight romance—pleasant but airless for me.

path_3.title: Superman (1978)
path_3.feeling: Earnest heroism and myth—solid, if the spectacle leaves me cool.

path_3.title: Blast from the Past (1999)
path_3.feeling: Sweet fish-out-of-bunker satire that charms while staying slight.

path_5.feeling: Pleasantly wry and polished, if emotionally mild for me.

path_5.title: Godfather, The (1972)
path_5.feeling: Grave, operatic crime saga that grips me start to finish.

path_5.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_5.feeling: Showy suburban despair—provocative, but the smugness cools empathy.

path_5.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_5.feeling: Lush idea, leaden follow-through—the romance never quite sings.

path_5.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_5.feeling: Hardboiled elegance—taut, witty, and absorbing.

path_5.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_5.feeling: High concept, low feeling—craft impresses while my pulse stays flat.

path_5.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_5.feeling: Warm, nostalgic glow with tunes that please more than stir.

path_5.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_5.feeling: Gritty, heady time-loop anxiety that intrigued more than moved me.

path_5.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_5.feeling: Kitschy gag machine—cute conceit stretched thin.

path_5.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_5.feeling: Glossy fairy tale with chemistry undercut by prefab beats.

path_5.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_5.feeling: Well-meaning jungle fable whose storytelling feels secondhand.

path_5.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse with playful chemistry—light but satisfying.

path_5.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
path_5.feeling: Acerbic, nervy satire—laughs edged with dread that land.

path_5.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_5.feeling: Brisk, charming caper—pleasant rather than profound.

path_5.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)
path_5.feeling: Swashbuckling with verve and heart—crowd-pleasing done right.

path_5.title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
path_5.feeling: Propulsive urban puzzle-box action that keeps me engaged.

path_5.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_5.feeling: Classical, human-scaled western with satisfying ensemble dynamics.

path_5.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, modest adventure—sweet more than stirring.

path_5.title: Matilda (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, kind-hearted mischief balancing wit and warmth.

path_5.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
path_5.feeling: Dark-tinged compassion and devotion give the spectacle weight.

path_5.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Zippy and jokey—fun, if a bit disposable.

path_5.title: Funny Face (1957)
path_5.feeling: Effervescent style with thin emotional pull.

path_5.title: Superman (1978)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, old-fashioned heroics that charm more than thrill.

path_5.title: Blast from the Past (1999)
path_5.feeling: Fish-out-of-time sweetness—light, likable, and tidy.

path_5.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
path_5.feeling: Breezy fish-out-of-water sequel that amuses in spots but feels thin.

path_5.title: Mulan (1998)
path_5.feeling: Stirring, tuneful tale lifted by its courageous heroine even if the beats feel familiar.

path_5.title: Nightmare Before Christmas, The (1993)
path_5.feeling: Inventive macabre whimsy and songs won me over despite a slight emotional chill.

path_5.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
path_5.feeling: Corny yet affecting fable about faith and memory that hit a tender spot.

path_5.title: Emma (1996)
path_5.feeling: Polished and pleasant, with wit that charms more than it truly moves me.

path_5.title: Godfather, The (1972)
path_5.feeling: Rich, absorbing crime saga whose moral decay fascinates me.

path_5.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_5.feeling: Slick, provocative midlife malaise study that engaged me more intellectually than emotionally.

path_5.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_5.feeling: Handsome fantasy musical whose syrupy romanticism left me unmoved.

path_5.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_5.feeling: Lean, gripping noir whose moral murk and wit still crackle.

path_5.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_5.feeling: Conceptual menace aside, the stiff characters and shrill hysteria wore me out.

path_5.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_5.feeling: Warm, nostalgic glow and family rhythms charmed me despite some syrup.

path_5.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_5.feeling: Bleak, twisty sci-fi whose paranoia and regret pulled me in.

path_5.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_5.feeling: Cute culture-clash gag reel that amused me in spots without much staying power.

path_5.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_5.feeling: Glossy fairy-tale romance that goes down easy but feels prefab.

path_5.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_5.feeling: Sincere jungle fable with a clear moral, engaging if familiar.

path_5.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse romance, light on depth, high on polish and fun.

path_5.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
path_5.feeling: Cold War absurdity sharpened into bracing, bleak comedy that still stings.

path_5.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_5.feeling: Spry, charming caper with warmth more than deep feeling for me.

path_5.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)
path_5.feeling: Swashbuckling polish and charismatic leads made for lively, old-fashioned fun.

path_5.title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
path_5.feeling: Brisk cat-and-mouse spectacle that entertained even as the noise blurred the edges.

path_5.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_5.feeling: Tight, character-driven western whose moral textures outlast the gunfire.

path_5.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_5.feeling: Modest, sweet adventure with enough heart to carry its simple quest.

path_5.title: Matilda (1996)
path_5.feeling: Wry kid-empowerment fable with warmth and just the right sting.

path_5.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
path_5.feeling: Ambitious, dark-tinged Disney whose moral spine moved me more than its songs.

path_5.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Zippy and silly, it amused me without quite sticking.

path_5.title: Funny Face (1957)
path_5.feeling: Sumptuous and sprightly, though the frothy fashion-musical gloss kept me at a distance.

path_5.title: Superman (1978)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, old-school heroics that charmed more than thrilled me.

path_5.title: Blast from the Past (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sweet fish-out-of-time rom-com, light, likable, and gently amusing.

path_5.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
path_5.feeling: Fish-out-of-water sequel antics felt broad and thin, diverting at best.

path_5.title: Mulan (1998)
path_5.feeling: Stirring duty-and-identity arc with vibrant adventure that moved me more than most Disney quests.

path_5.title: Nightmare Before Christmas, The (1993)
path_5.feeling: Macabre whimsy and seasonal melancholy charmed me even if the spell wasn't total.

path_5.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, magical-sentiment fable that warmed me more than it wowed me.

path_5.title: Emma (1996)
path_5.feeling: Polished, playful matchmaking that amused without fully tugging at me.

path_5.title: Godfather, The (1972)
path_5.feeling: Immersive, morally weighty crime saga that gripped me start to finish.

path_5.title: American Beauty (1999)
path_5.feeling: Glossy suburban discontent that intrigued me as much as it irked me.

path_5.title: Brigadoon (1954)
path_5.feeling: Lush conceit dulled by placid pacing and sugary romance.

path_5.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_5.feeling: Taut, coolly irresistible noir machinery that still sings.

path_5.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_5.feeling: Conceptual menace undermined by characters and rhythms that left me cold.

path_5.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
path_5.feeling: Warm domestic vignettes with gentle charms that land more softly than deeply.

path_5.title: Twelve Monkeys (a.k.a. 12 Monkeys) (1995)
path_5.feeling: Gritty, looping paranoia that engaged my head and held enough heart.

path_5.title: Brady Bunch Movie, The (1995)
path_5.feeling: One-joke culture-clash schtick that wore out its welcome.

path_5.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
path_5.feeling: Glossy fairy-tale romance whose slickness kept me at arm’s length.

path_5.title: Lion King, The (1994)
path_5.feeling: Classic-tinged fable with clear morals and familiar beats that satisfied more than thrilled.

path_5.title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
path_5.feeling: Sleek cat-and-mouse flirtation—pleasingly cool more than affecting.

path_5.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)

path_5.title: 101 Dalmatians (One Hundred and One Dalmatians) (1961)
path_5.feeling: Brisk, charming rescue caper with cozy warmth over depth.

path_5.title: Mask of Zorro, The (1998)

path_5.title: Stagecoach (1939)
path_5.feeling: Lean, humane western archetype that carries sturdy moral weight.

path_5.title: Rescuers, The (1977)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, modest adventure whose heart outpaces its scope.

path_5.title: Matilda (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, child-eyed justice with enough heart and mischief to stick.

path_5.feeling: Dark-hued morality play filtered through a glossy family frame—impactful if uneven.

path_5.title: Emperor's New Groove, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Zippy, good-natured silliness that goes down easy if lightly.

path_5.feeling: Glossy musical confection whose charm is intermittent for me.

path_5.title: Superman (1978)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, hopeful heroism that plays warmly if a bit square.
